Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cells were transfected with empty pcDNA3 vector or different DJ-1 cDNAs

Readout description.Result Description: DJ-1 mutants did not modify 6OHDA-associated cell death.
DJ-1 mutants did not modify 6OHDA-associated cell death.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Based on custom knowledge, a normal readout would be a low number of TUNEL-positive cells, indicating minimal cell death.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Based on custom knowledge, an abnormal readout would be a high number of TUNEL-positive cells, indicating significant cell death.

Material used.Description: Telencephalon Specific Mouse 1 (TSM1), Human Embryonic Kidney 293 cells (HEK293), SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cells, and Mouse Embryonic Fibroblasts (MEF)

Readout description.Result Description: L166P and D149A mutations abrogate WT-DJ-1 drastically reduces 6OHDA-stimulated caspase-3 activation.
L166P and D149A mutations abrogate WT-DJ-1 drastically reduces 6OHDA-stimulated caspase-3 activation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Based on custom knowledge, normal protein expression levels for wild-type DJ-1 in control conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Based on custom knowledge, reduced or absent protein expression for mutant DJ-1 in treated conditions, or altered levels of caspase-3 and p53

Material used.Description: Total RNA from cells was extracted using the RNeasy kit following the instructions of the manufacturer (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany).

Readout description.Result Description: WT-DJ-1 but not mutated DJ-1 decreases p53 promoter transactivation (mpp53, Fig. 2A, left panel) and mRNA levels (Fig. 2A, right panel).
WT-DJ-1 but not mutated DJ-1 decreases p53 promoter transactivation (mpp53, Fig. 2A, left panel) and mRNA levels (Fig. 2A, right panel).

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent experiments performed in triplicates

Basic positive control.Description: Relative expressions levels of p53, DJ-1 and V5-tagged-DJ-1 genes were normalized for RNA concentrations with the housekeeping gene mouse -actin.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Based on custom knowledge, a higher mRNA expression level indicates that the gene is being actively transcribed, whereas a lower mRNA expression level indicates that the gene is not being actively transcribed

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Based on custom knowledge, a higher mRNA expression level indicates that the gene is being actively transcribed, whereas a lower mRNA expression level indicates that the gene is not being actively transcribed

Material used.Description: Mouse Embryonic Fibroblasts were lysed in 10mM Tris-HCl pH7.5 buffer

Readout description.Result Description: Co-immunoprecipitation experiments show that endogenous and overexpressed WT-DJ-1 physically interact with p53. Interestingly, this interaction was abolished by DJ-1 pathogenic mutations.
Co-immunoprecipitation experiments show that endogenous and overexpressed WT-DJ-1 physically interact with p53. Interestingly, this interaction was abolished by DJ-1 pathogenic mutations.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Based on custom knowledge, it would mean they are binding to each other normally

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Based on custom knowledge, abnormal readout would mean that either protein is not present during immunoprecipitation

Material used.Material Name: Promega TNT coupled reticulocyte lysate system
Material used.Description: Wild-type and mutated DJ-1 were transcribed and translated by means of the Promega TNT coupled reticulocyte lysate system

Readout description.Result Description: D149A-DJ-1 fully resisted proteolysis by caspase-6 while the L166P mutation apparently enhanced DJ-1 susceptibility to recombinant caspase-6
D149A-DJ-1 fully resisted proteolysis by caspase-6 while the L166P mutation apparently enhanced DJ-1 susceptibility to recombinant caspase-6

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Based on custom knowledge, protein band present when stained

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Based on custom knowledge, protein band not present when stained

Readout description.Result Description: L166P and D149A mutations abrogate WT-DJ-1 drastically reduces 6OHDA-stimulated caspase-3 activation.
L166P and D149A mutations abrogate WT-DJ-1 drastically reduces 6OHDA-stimulated caspase-3 activation.

Basic positive control.Description: cells were grown in 6-well plates and incubated without or with staurosporine (STS) or 6-hydroxydopamine (6OHDA) for various time and concentrations.

Basic negative control.Description: In some cases, cells were pre-treated or not for 30 min with LY294002 (10ÂµM).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Based on custom knowledge, a certain basal level of caspase-3 activity is always present

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Based on custom knowledge, the caspase-3 activity is higher
